subject: Leadership
title: Emotional Regulation
description: A quick, practical guide to Emotional Regulation.

hook.text: A leader gets bad news in a meeting and snaps at the team. Ten minutes of anger undoes ten months of trust.

buildup.text: Emotional regulation isn't suppression. It's the ability to feel emotions fully while choosing how to respond.

discovery.text: The amygdala hijack: stress triggers fight-or-flight before the rational brain catches up. The gap is about six seconds.

twist.text: Suppressing emotions backfires. Bottled feelings leak as sarcasm, withdrawal, or sudden explosions. Feel it, name it.

climax.text: Pause before reacting. Name the emotion: 'I'm frustrated.' Labeling engages the prefrontal cortex and calms amygdala.

punchline.text: Between stimulus and response, there's a space. Leaders live there.

quiz.question: What happens during an amygdala hijack?
options: You lose all memory of the event
